intro: Galium scabrelloides, commonly known as the rough-stemmed bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences and are usually white or pale pink in color. Galium scabrelloides is known for its delicate appearance and its role in supporting local insect populations.
